DOC.detailed_description: This prospective , randomize , control , interventional pilot study analyze provider ' patient ' perception response DNA Insight test . Twelve military health system primary care provider 4 provider 's patient enrol study . ( 12 provider 48 patient total ) Each provider 's patient randomize delayed treatment ( Group A ) immediate treatment ( Group B ) 1:1 ratio . All patient receive Pain Medication Mental Health DNA InsightTM test ( intervention ) . Results patient Group A give provider 3 month delay . Those 3 month delay serve comparison group period prior receive intervention . Results patient Group B give provider without delay , 2-3 week saliva sample collection . The provider use result Pain Medication Mental Health DNA InsightTM test evaluate whether change medication indicate base individual patient 's genetic profile . A measure provider 's certainty , confidence , satisfaction , perception care global impression change assess baseline , prior obtain test result , obtain test result , outline data collection section . Patients ' pain relate self-reported outcome , certainty , confidence satisfaction assess baseline , prior obtain DNA InsightTM test result , receipt implementation test result , describe data collection section protocol . At baseline visit ( Visit 0 ) enrol patient provide saliva sample Pain Medication DNA InsightTM test identifies genetic variation CYP metabolism . The provider patient recruit Womack Army Medical Center 's Primary Care Medical Homes family practice clinic .
DOC.criteria: Military healthcare system beneficiary enrol Womack Army Medical Center Health Care System Age 18 old Patient enrol provider least 3 month . Persisting pain least 3 month , average daily pain score 4 high expect improve without directed therapy . No history chronic liver kidney disease Known pregnancy breast feeding Planned deployment , permanent change station , military separation within upcoming 6 month
